profile.name: Milad Afkhami
profile.job: Head of Front-End Development Team at Arsh Co.
profile.jobDescription0: More than 4 years of experience in front-end development
profile.jobDescription-1: Working as a Front-End developer and helping other members in their problems.
profile.jobDescription:
A skilled software engineer 
with a proven ability to analyze, design, develop and maintain large scale software solutions that meet business requirements as well as performance and quality indexes.

about.p1: Hey, I'm Milad. I'm a developer, student, kind of a teacher, and at late nights writer! I work at Arsh Co. as head of front-end development team.
about.p2: I grew up in Shahr-e-Rey a district in south of Tehran state.
about.p3: I spent my elementary school and middle school and then got accepted for <abbr title="World Health Organization">NODET</abbr> and spent my high school in there.
about.p4: After that I got accepted to study electrical engineering in Shahid Beheshti University after I was ranked 697 in national entrance exam
about.p5: I really didn't felt being an electrical engineering and after couple of semesters, I changed my field to computer engineering and till then I am working as a developer and enjoying it.
about.p6: I spend my free time listening to musics, reading, watching tv shows and enjoying time with close friends.

timeline.born: Born and raised as an only child ...
timeline.earlySchool: when I was 4 I took a test to see if i'm ready for school and I passed it, but I was even smaller than kids in my age so my parents decided that I stick to the routine.
timeline.startingSchool: Nothing spacial to say about that, like every other iranian kid, I went to a school under a system that kill kids creativity and happiness.
timeline.firstComputer: My father bought a computer for my 10th birthday, Whoa!
timeline.choosingNEA: After all my putting all my efforts and love to learning the thing I loved the most (talking about Mathematics), I decided to concentrate on national entrance exam
timeline.university: Endeavor paid off, I got accepted to study electrical engineering at Shahid Beheshti university
timeline.changeField: After one year of flip-flopping, I decided to change my field of study to computed engineering. I can't forget the hell my parents raised for me for doing that.
timeline.firstDayAtWork: As a night owl, I had a firm reason to hate that day and the days ahead, but my love for learning and competing helped me keep going
timeline.leftMyFirstJob: As time goes by, I realized it wasn't really anything to learn for me in that company, so I officially quited my first job
timeline.startingAtAppTech: I found a good company to learn new stuffs, even though the guys there were total jerks I didn't wanted to leave early. I learned React and React Native there
timeline.startingAtArshCo: After reaching a good knowledge of React, I decided to have a new challenge and working on larger projects and I chose Arsh Company to continue. despite my last superiors they were really  nice to me
timeline.becomingTeamLead: I proved myself to headquarters in my challenges and earned this
